title: Drawing, "Project for a Fountain", 1800–10
medium: Pencil, pen, ink, Chinese blackwashes.  Olive water color.  Paper
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
description: A woman, wearing a helmet and holding fasces with both heads standing in a niche.  Water is intended to be spit out by a female mask on the pedestal.  Basin with round parapet.  Aedicula topped by an attic showing a relief and flanked by obelisks.  Circular pediment with a trophy of arms inside, on top.  Underneath: 3/4 of the plan.  Bottom left: scale: "Scala di/Modula" and "Scala Piedi di Bolog(na)"  Monogram in left bottom corner. Framing as -5187.

tombstone.epitaph: Drawing, "Project for a Fountain", 1800–10.Pencil, pen, ink, Chinese blackwashes.  Olive water color.  Paper. Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund. 1938-88-5193.
